User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:8.0a1) Gecko/20110802 Firefox/8.0a1
Build ID: 20110802030845

Steps to reproduce:

I have a custom userChrome.css with tab min-width at 20px. You can see in the screenshot how tabs are rendered, in particular the X mark is not fully rendered and the favicon is overflowing the tab.




Expected results:

This is a regression. In the old days of FF3, I had the same settings set in about:config and the current tab was expanding exactly as much as it needed to draw both the favicon and X mark correctly. See the ff3-tabs.png attachment.

comments.text:
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:9.0a1) Gecko/20110927 Firefox/9.0a1

Reproducible on Nightly using the following steps:

1. Create a custom userChrome.css in the current profile.
2. Set min.width to 20px using the following command: 

.tabbrowser-tab[fadein]:not([pinned]) {
 min-width: 20px !important;
}

3. Start a nightly with the respective profile.
4. Create tabs until the tab width reaches its minimum value.

The tab favicon and X button are overflowing.

Checked in Firefox 4, its reproducible there too. As specified in Comment 0, probably a regression from Firefox 3.
